Hello Noah,

Thanks for the reply.

In addition to setting sendIfModifiedS=
ince property to false I also had to set the sendIfNoneMatch property to fa=
lse to get it working.
Now the deduplication works perfectly fine.

Thanks =
again.
Sriram Varahan.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt=
 <nlevitt@...> wrote:
>
> You say "It found there was no modification" - by=
 this do you mean the server returned a 304? 
> 
> If that is the case, the=
n you probably want to set the fetchHttp property "sendIfModifiedSince" to =
false. With that setting disabled (and certain other settings retaining the=
ir default values), heritrix will fetch the content and extract links from =
it, as it normally does. Deduplication will still be enabled, too, except i=
t will examine the content to check for duplication instead of asking the s=
erver. (Relevant settings include the warcWriter properties skipIdenticalDi=
gests and writeRevisitForIdenticalDigests.)
> 
> Noah
> 
> 
> sriram_varaha=
n1 wrote:
> > Hello,
> >  
> >       I am using Heritrix-3.1.1 Snapshot rel=
ease. 
> >
> > I have enabled the deduplication feature. I first mirrored a=
 site and got about 270 pages.
> >
> > Now I relaunched the job. Heritrix j=
ust checked for the seed url. It found there was no modification in it and =
hence it did not check the other pages in the site for updates.
> >
> > Is =
this the expected behaviour in deduplication?
> >
> > As a workaround I  pu=
lled all the links from the crawl.log and populated them in seeds.txt. It t=
hen checked the other pages as well.
> >
> > Is there any other way of gett=
ing around this problem?
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Sriram Varahan.
> >
> >
> >
> =
>
> >
